svg:

1. Global State (Local state is bad!) - In redux, the state is global, but it is read only.2. Components subscribe to slices of state they need. - remember, "project the application state"3. Components describe interactions with Actions. - when something happens, there is an "Action" that described the interaction.4. A single function that receives, over time, every action - reducer(Action, CurrentState): NewStateUpdate our definition of State: - "Current value of all the meaningful variables" - Changing over time - you have an initial state. - things happen and that might need a new state.Our application starts at an "Initial State" Stuff happens That stuff makes a new state.- We need to define our initial state of our application- We need to define the interactions (actions) - what can happen?- We need to write a function that says when this happens, what should our next state be.
